article.description: Kevin Foster scored 28 points and Santa Clara defeated Loyola Marymount 79-72 Saturday night.
article.headline: Loyola Marymount falls short after slow start
article.linkText: Loyola Marymount falls short after slow start
article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Kevin Foster scored 28 points and Santa Clara defeated Loyola Marymount 79-72 Saturday night. Marc Trasolini added 16 points, Evan Roquemore had 15 and Ben Dowdell 11 for the Broncos (14-9, 5-2 West Coast Conference), who have won a season-high four straight. Troy Payne had a career-high 12 rebounds and six steals. Vernon Teel led the Lions (9-13, 1-6) with 21 points, Drew Viney scored 13 and Ashley Hamilton 12. Santa Clara scored the first 11 points, went into halftime up 38-28 and led by 20 in the second half in sweeping the WCC's Los Angeles area schools -- it beat Pepperdine 71-59 Thursday -- on the road for the first time since 2005. Foster added a career-high six steals and was 13 for 13 from the foul line.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
